item.title: Haggai 1
item.description:
Haggai Chapter 1

1 The First Day, Sixth Month, Second Year of King Darius 2"The LORD says, ‘These people are saying this is no time to be rebuilding the LORD’s Temple.’"

3 A message came by Haggai, 4"Is this a time for you to be living in your paneled houses while my Temple lies in ruins?"

6 You sow a lot, but reap a little; 8"Go up into the mountains to get lumber; rebuild the Temple so I can be pleased with it and honored by it. 9You look for a good crop, but it comes in poor. When you haul it in, I blow it away. Why? Because my Temple is lying in ruins while your interest lies in your own houses. 10So the sky hasn’t dropped dew, and the ground hasn’t produced crops. 11I called for a drought on the fields and hills: the grain, new wine, and olive oilâ€”on what the ground grows; on you, your livestock, and your efforts."

item.title: Haggai 2
item.description:
Haggai Chapter 2

1 The Twenty-First Day, Seventh Month 2"Ask Zerubbabel, Joshua/Jeshua the high priest, and the remnant, 3’How many of you saw this Temple in its former beauty? How does it look to you now? Doesn’t it seem like nothing in comparison? 4But resolve to work because I’m with you. 5Like I promised when you came out of Egypt, my Spirit’s among you so you needn’t be afraid!’ 6"Soon I’m going to shake earth and sky one more time, ocean and dry land, 7as well as the nations. Pilgrims will bring wealth from every country to fill this Temple with beauty. 8Silver and gold belong to me. 9This Temple’s beauty will be greater than the former, and there’ll be peace here."
